results.definition: in a state of progressive putrefaction
lack of integrity or honesty (especially susceptibility to bribery); use of a position of trust for dishonest gain
destroying someone's (or some group's) honesty or loyalty; undermining moral integrity
moral perversion; impairment of virtue and moral principles
examples: the luxury and corruption among the upper classes

results.definition: decay of matter (as by rot or oxidation)
inducement (as of a public official) by improper means (as bribery) to violate duty (as by commiting a felony)
examples: he was held on charges of corruption and racketeering
